{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=EA7400 |revision=v2 |asin=B01KMZP0H0 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |fcc_date=10/20/2016 |fcc_id=Q87-EA7500V2 |ic_id=3839A-EA7500V2 |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7621AT;MEDIATEK, MT7621AT, 1619-AMTH, CTPA1V09, DTPA1G94; |cpu1_cspeed=880 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX30LF1G18AC-TI |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5CC128M16IP-DI |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7615N;MEDIATEK, ARM, MT7615N, 1612-BFSL, ACMSSKNS; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=4 |wi1_rxchains=4 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7615N;MEDIATEK, ARM, MT7615N, 1612-BFSL, ACMSSKNS; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |flags=Wave2, MU-MIMO, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_pass=admin }}
:• '''1300''' Mbps - 3SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''450''' Mbps - 3SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''1750 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|Max-Stream AC1750 MU-MIMO Gigabit Router}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-EA7400/}} {{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=EA7400|pid=01t34000003wEDLAA2}} Despite Linksys claims of only three-stream speeds, version 2.0 appears to be wired :up for four tx/rx chains with three external antennas and one internal antenna. It may actually support four spatial streams and higher-than-advertised speeds. :[https://fccid.io/Q87-EA7500V2/Test-Report/RF-Report-NII-3167995 RF Report NII] at the FCC shows 4 transmit and 4 receive chains. [https://fccid.io/Q87-EA7500V2/RF-Exposure-Info/MPE-Test-Report-3168020 FCC documents] also cover the AC1750 [[Linksys EA7400 v2]] which supposedly :disables 256-QAM in 802.11ac to differentiate it for marketing purposes :although 256-QAM is likely disabled for 802.11n, not 802.11ac. [https://fccid.io/Q87-EA7500V2/Test-Report/RF-Report-NII-3167995 RF Report NII] at the FCC shows 4 transmit and 4 receive chains. [https://fccid.io/Q87-EA7500V2/RF-Exposure-Info/MPE-Test-Report-3168020 FCC documents] claim that the EA7400 v2 lacks "256QAM in 802.11ac" to differentiate :it for marketing purposes but Linksys claims speeds of 1300/450Mbps which would :suggest that 256-QAM is disabled for the 802.11n radio instead. ===Links=== *[http://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=191827 ''Getting to know the Linksys EA7400 Router'' on '''Linksys'''] *[https://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=183942 ''Getting to know the Linksys EA7500 Router'' on '''Linksys'''] {{See also|Linksys EA7300 v2|Linksys EA7500 v2}} __NOTOC__
